Row.Text: You have dispersed a villainous Barbarian Encampment and recovered {1_NumGold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold from it!

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Annexing[ENDCOLOR] the City into your empire causes it to become a normal City that produces quite a bit of extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Annexing this City will yield {2_Num} [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles and increase [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness by {1_Num}.
[NEWLINE]You do not have enough [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles. Accumulate [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles by annexing cities and killing Barbarians.

[NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT][ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Slaves earn 50% less XP from combat and cost 100% more to upgrade. However, they may move immediately after purchase.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Spending [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles will increase your [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance Sentiment.[ENDCOLOR]
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles that the city that established the trade route generates from this trade route.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles that the destination city would receive from this trade route.
You are receiving +{1_Num} [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles on this route to your city.
They are receiving +{1_Num} [ICON_JFD_SHACKLES] Shackles on this route from your city.
